subject: AI & Agents
title: Who Controls the Foundation Models?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Who Controls the Foundation Models?.

hook.text: Five companies control the most powerful AI models on Earth. That's a lot of power for a few hands.

buildup.text: Training frontier models costs hundreds of millions, limiting who can compete.

discovery.text: OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, Meta, and a few others set the capabilities and limits of AI.

twist.text: Their safety decisions, content policies, and access rules shape what billions of people can do.

climax.text: Open-source models redistribute power, but frontier capabilities remain concentrated.

punchline.text: Whoever builds the model writes the rules.

quiz.question: Why is AI power concentrated in few companies?
options: Training frontier models costs hundreds of millions of dollars
Only a few people understand AI
